messages.subject: Re: Where to go for cheat codes
messages.msgSnippet: ... DH said gamespot is also a good one. Mostly though he just googles the game and cheats and makes sure not to download or click on anything (and makes
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, blessed54321@w... wrote:
>
> www.gamefaq.com is a good one my sons use all the time and we have
>not had
> any problem with ...
> JUNE
>
DH said gamespot is also a good one. Mostly though he just googles the
game and 'cheats' and makes sure not to download or click on anything
(and makes sure the spyware detector, popup blocker, firewall and
virus software is all up and running)

--Deb

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: Where to go for cheat codes
messages.msgSnippet: Universal Hint System: uhs-hints.com (Not sure how good it is for console games, which I mostly don t play, but for PC games, this is the best site I ve seen
messages.messageBody:
Universal Hint System: uhs-hints.com
(Not sure how good it is for console games, which I mostly don't
play, but for PC games, this is the best site I've seen for hints.
It doesn't out and out state the answer at first, but gives you a
graduated list of clues until you can figure it out.)

messages.messageBody:

any problem with ...
JUNE

messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Where to go for cheat codes
messages.msgSnippet: My son says: www.cheatplanet.com  www.supercheats.com  www.cheatcodes.com
messages.messageBody:
My son says:

www.cheatplanet.com <http://www.cheatplanet.com/>

www.supercheats.com <http://www.supercheats.com/>

www.cheatcodes.com <http://www.cheatcodes.com/>



Aubrey



_____

From: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Donald and Sandra
Winn
Sent: Thursday, November 03, 2005 8:21 AM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Where to go for cheat codes



Does anyone know a good website to go to for PS2 cheat
codes, that is safe? Meaning, a site that will not
give our computer a virus and/or trojan horse?
Whenever my kids type cheat codes in the search
engine, they go to a site and then we get a virus
and/or a trojan horse. I don't mind them getting the
codes but I do mind getting the bad stuff, we have
much personal info stored on our computer.



Happy Learning,
~Sandy
www.360.yahoo.com/aplan4life

messages.subject: Re: Where to go for cheat codes
messages.msgSnippet: ... I emailed my resident gamer, DH, to see where he goes for cheats for the PS2. One thing to check also is look for individual games websites for cheats
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Donald and Sandra Winn
<aplan4life@y...> wrote:
>
> Does anyone know a good website to go to for PS2 cheat
> codes, that is safe? Meaning, a site that will not
> give our computer a virus and/or trojan horse?
> Whenever my kids type cheat codes in the search
> engine, they go to a site and then we get a virus
> and/or a trojan horse. I don't mind them getting the
> codes but I do mind getting the bad stuff, we have
> much personal info stored on our computer.
>
I emailed my resident gamer, DH, to see where he goes for cheats for
the PS2. One thing to check also is look for individual games'
websites for cheats rather than just PS2.

I'll let you know when I find out anything (my guys are probably
getting ready to head out to the park to take advantage of the lovely
unusually warm sunny November weather we're having)

--Deb
